item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Weather for Saturday UPDATE Its not the best but looks OK, Cloudy and a possible sprink in the afternoon.

If conditions change on the water we can easily modify our trip.

I am proposing just head to Columbia and do the Barbie-q under the Pavillion, its on the way home for the majority of us anyway, but lets see ?


I will update if necessary by apx 9 to 10 am the day of the event. so far this morning ..its still ON..

For more specific weather at our paddling area:
http://www.usairnet.c...

--------------------------------------
The grill and fire pit is already loaded.

I see a Bass fishing tournament of 12 boats scheduled for Saturday ?,

http://www.ct.gov/dep...

The river near the airport is the one that comes from Diana's Pool that we found to be a great place in the fall season picknicks.

After the paddling event is also the Pot Luck Picknick nearby so remember to be prepared to join us.

___

Getting There:
Mansfield Hollow Boat Launch:

For GPS use 300 Bassetts Bridge Road Mansfield Center CT, (its close enough)..
mapquest or other...just compare the directions below to what you get..they better be similar..

The meetup map link above looks ok.

Option 1--From Hartford take I-84 heading EAST, take Exit 68 = south on rte 195 through Storrs to Mansfield ctr (about 11 miles from 84)
Go 0.5 mile past rte 89 junction and turn left onto Bassset Bridge Rd at the stoplight, should see Mansfield Hollow Park sign.
Go apx 1 mile Will see a picknick area on left but go a bit further apx 0.5 miles to the access right before the bridge on the left.

From Hartford option 2--- take I-384 East toward Bolton, bear right onto rte 6 and follow rte 6 toward Willimantic.

rte 6 and rte 66 will intersect at a light. Take a left on to 6.

Follow this highway to the second exit, go straight (=rte 633 or S. Frontage Rd.) it is actually a parallel to rte 6 connector to rte 195, (and heads towards the Mall & food store..etc)

Signs for UCONN should be there somewhere too,

Go North on rte 195 toward UCONN for about 2 miles then turn right at the onto Basset Bridge Rd,

You Will see a picknick area on left but go a bit further apx 0.5 miles to the access right before the bridge on the left.

The picknick area you passed will be where we go after the paddling is done if we choose this location ?

Remember and PRINT the directions.LOL

At the boat launch, i will park as close to the bridge tunnels as i can, so look for me in that area.


Ok bring some food, chaire, bugg juice and other stuff for several hours on the water and the picknick after.

Saturday May 29, start paddling by 12 noon.

(if you arrive late, we will be heading North to the UP stream towards the Fenton River.
then we return to go through the tunnels to the dam side)

I will be wearing the orange hat.

Why earlier ? to get ya all used to it, remember last years traffic to the beach ?
The parking , and of course a longer time to enjoy the locations.

Bring sun protection , water, and some paddling gloves, etc.

Oh yes, almost forgot, Bring a snack for the Half Point of our trip while stopping at a bridge where that Dilliverance Movie Banjo Player is waiting (throw him some Pork Skins).


As with all my trips, i don't give specifics, its for your discovery as i discovered them for my first time,
and i dont offer the paddling time or milage.. when we are done ..we are done--- when we are done paddling then its the barbie-q.. anticipate the entire day and a good part of the evening by a nice fire. Real wood or my special fire pit.
-----------


xxxxxxx
Kayaks available:

Paddle & Leash, Life Jacket with whistle is included with any of my yaks.

Dougnation of 20 bucks for my kayaks reserved for this particular event.
Its way less than what sport shops charge and the yaks & Paddles are top quality dillivered and picked up at the site etc..

Please make sure you are familiar with the yak you choose and can fit in them since i don't have any wide yaks anymore.


I will only bring the yaks that are confirmed by a yes and by persons i have some familiarity with..

Maybee's obviously can't reserve any yaks and if ya reserve one and don't show up ya won't ever get a second chance to again.

Sorry i don't like to leave un-attended yaks on the trailer. They get stolen too easily.


IF USING MY YAKS YOU CANT LOOK LIKE A BONEHEADED BEGINNER AND STEP INTO THEM VIA THE FLOOR OR DRIVE UP ON SHORE WITH THEM LIKE YOU ARE GOING TO A DRIVE IN MOVIE. Only Novices in cheap boats do that...

READ THE INFO ON THE FOLLOWING LINK: I will also show you the correct way and you will look like a intelligent seasoned pro and impress the others who don't know how. Or you may laugh at the ones that fall in who don't know how.
http://www.ehow.com/h...
Hint: always get out parallel to shore.

Please review the links below for the equipment specifications to be at least familiar with which boat or equipment you would be best suited for.

Cheap LIfe Jackets with a whistle is all i have for you since a GOOD QUALITY LIFE JACKET should be chosen for your particular body shapes and paddling style, and tight fit adjusted...if you have your own please bring it..
------------------
All my yaks come with Werner Carbon Kalliste Paddles (my recommended brand and type). Different lengths and types of the same version are in the bucket.

http://www.wernerpadd...

(No ya cant use these paddles for paddle float entry practice. i have some cheap ones for that.)-
------------------

Also for comfort is my favourtie Yak Pad optional accessory to all yaks on trips that we are actually going somewhere..

http://www.yakpads.co...

-------------------

Riot Tourlite 15, Blue, Rudder Equipped.
For small paddler (apx 150 lbs) with Intermediate Experience.

http://wickedwaters.c...

transitional kayak, 15'= THIS KAYAK IS FOR SALE $550.00.....I will have this at the event to try if reserved... = SOLD
----------------------

Cobra Expidition, Yellow, Rudder Equipped.
For an average sized paddler apx (150 to 220 lbs) with Intermediate experience.

http://www.cobrakayak...

Fast Sea kayak, Sit On Top type, moderate to low initial stability, 18', = THIS KAYAK IS FOR SALE $500.00.....I will have this at the event to try if reserved... = . RESERVED FOR BETH

------------------------------

Eddyline Wind Dancer, Red, Rudder Equipped.
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with Novice and up skills.

http://www.epinions.c...

highly stable (initial & secondary) comfortable Sea kayak, 18'=
. RESERVED FOR LAURA Z..

---------------------------------

NDK Greenlander Pro, Red, Skeg Equipped.
Medium sized paddler (150-200 lbs) with Intermediate to Advanced skills.

http://www.atlanticka...

fast Greenland style Sea kayak, moderated stability, 18'= AVAILABLE BUT NOT ENOUGH SPACE TO TRANSPORT .

----------------------------------

Necky Eliza Composite Ultra Light (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.

http://www.belhavenca...

stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak, 15'3.0"= . RESERVED FOR MAUREEN

------------------------------------

Necky Eliza Composite Ultra Light (Modified), Yellow, Skeg Version.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.

http://www.belhavenca...

stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak, 15'3.0"= . RESERVED FOR NINA

-----------------------------------

Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.

http://www.neckykayak...

stable and predictable Transitional type moderate weight (50 LB) ladies kayak, 15'3.5"= RESERVED FOR MARYBETH ??

----------------------------------

Guillemot Night Heron

Greenland Paddle available also if desired.

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 150 - 220 Lbs) with beginner/intermediate and up skills.

http://www.guillemot-...

Overall a stable and predictable Sea kayak with Greenland style hull (45 lbs), 18' =
. RESERVED FOR AL-R

--------------------------------------------
THE AFTER PARTY CAN BE RIGHT AT MANSFIELD HOLLOW PICNIC AREA (NEARBY)

OR

At COLUMBIA RECREATIONAL FIELD UNDER THE PAVILION Which IS A BIT MORE SECLUDED AND PRIVATE FOR US..WE MAKE OUR DECISION AFTER THE PADDLING IS DONE AS TO WHICH WE MAY LIKE MORE..
I do not know if its reserved yet.
If we choose the Pavillion, its on the way home for most of us, continue on
rte 66 EAST,
cross over rte 6, and go apx 3 miles to a flashing yellow light, take THAT right onto HENNIQUIN RD, go apx 1 mile to the park entrance on the left.
Apx GPS is 34 Henniquin Rd, Columbia ct


See you there.
AL-r
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Kayak Trailer - Orange Stryped Cones at boat "CARRY IN" area Orange Hat also.

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT

item.name: *KAYAK EVENT* Mansfield Hollow Reservoir Areas & Group Pot Luck Barbie-Q Nearby
